column2: NE DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column6: NE

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: sound the horn.

column2: 2. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 3. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column6: that a divided highway ends
column8: of two-way traffic

column2: 4. Regulatory signs:
column6: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column8: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.
column10: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column10: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 6. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 7. Drivers are required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
column6: True

column2: 8. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 9. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 10. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: speed limits do not apply at night.
column6: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column8: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.

column2: 11. When a driver has their left arm and hand extended upward, the driver plans to:
column6: go straight ahead.
column8: turn right.

column2: 12. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
13. This is:
column6: a merging traffic sign.
column8: a right curve sign.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow
column8: Low shoulder

column2: 15. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 16. The two most frequent causes of motorcycle accidents are:
column4: excessive speed and following too closely.
column6: inattention by the motorcycle driver and bad road conditions.
column8: making a left turn in front of an oncoming vehicle and failure to yield the right-of-way.

column2: 17. The shape and color of a route number sign indicate the type of roadway.
column6: True

column2: 18. All children and adolescents aged 6-18 are required to ride:
column6: secured in a safety belt or child safety seat.
column8: in the front seat.

column2: 19. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.
column6: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.
column8: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.

column2: 20. What does this sign indicate?
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 21. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 22. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 23. When passing another vehicle:
column4: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column6: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column8: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
column10: there is no need to signal.

column2: 24. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column6: Stop.
column8: Yield.

column2: 25. The major cause of rear-end crashes in work zones is:
column4: work area protection equipment not working as expected.
column6: the lack of work zone signs alerting drivers.
column8: driving slower or faster than the flow of traffic.
